subject: Medicine
title: Abortion: The Ethical Divide
description: A 60-second lesson on Abortion: The Ethical Divide.

hook.text: Abortion is legal in some countries and punishable by prison in others. Medicine alone can't resolve the debate.

buildup.text: The core ethical question is when a developing embryo gains moral status and the right to life.

discovery.text: Arguments involve bodily autonomy, fetal viability, religious beliefs, and the right to reproductive choice.

twist.text: Most people hold nuanced views‚Äîsupporting access in some cases but not all‚Äîyet the debate is framed as absolute.

climax.text: Medical ethics can't declare a winner. It can ensure that whatever laws exist, patients receive compassionate care.

punchline.text: Ethics frames the question. Society chooses the answer.

quiz.question: What is the core ethical question in the abortion debate?
options: When a developing embryo gains moral status and rights
Whether doctors should be allowed to perform surgeries
Which religious tradition has the correct view
